g2201.definition: [ζεῦγος] from the same as {{g2218}}; a couple, i.e. a team (of oxen yoked together) or brace (of birds tied together)

g2202.definition: [ζευκτηρία] feminine of a derivative (at the second stage) from the same as {{g2218}}; a fastening (tiller-rope)

g2203.definition: [Ζεύς] of uncertain affinity; in the oblique cases there is used instead of it a (probably cognate) name      Δίς, which is otherwise obsolete;        Zeus or Dis (among the Latins, Jupiter or Jove), the supreme deity of the Greeks

g2204.definition: [ζέω] a primary verb; to be hot (boil, of liquids; or glow, of solids), i.e. (figuratively) be fervid (earnest)

g2205.definition: [ζῆλος] from {{g2204}}; properly, heat, i.e. (figuratively) "zeal" (in a favorable sense, ardor; in an unfavorable one, jealousy, as of a husband (figuratively, of God), or an enemy, malice)

g2206.definition: [ζηλόω] from {{g2205}}; to have warmth of feeling for or against

g2208.definition: [Ζηλωτής] the same as {{g2207}}; a Zealot, i.e. (specially) partisan for Jewish political independence

g2209.definition: [ζημία] probably akin to the base of {{g1150}} (through the idea of violence); detriment

g2210.definition: [ζημιόω] from {{g2209}}; to injure, i.e. (reflexively or passively) to experience detriment

g2211.definition: [Ζηνᾶς] probably contracted from a poetic form of {{g2203}} and {{g1435}}; Jove-given; Zenas, a Christian

g2212.definition: [ζητέω] of uncertain affinity; to seek (literally or figuratively); specially, (by Hebraism) to worship (God), or (in a bad sense) to plot (against life) Compare {{g4441}}.

g2213.definition: [ζήτημα] from {{g2212}}; a search (properly concretely), i.e. (in words) a debate

g2214.definition: [ζήτησις] from {{g2212}}; a searching (properly, the act), i.e. a dispute or its theme

g2215.definition: [ζιζάνιον] of uncertain origin; darnel or false grain

g2216.definition: [Ζοροβάβελ] of Hebrew origin ({{h2216}}); Zorobabel (i.e. Zerubbabel), an Israelite

g2217.definition: [ζόφος] akin to the base of {{g3509}}; gloom (as shrouding like a cloud)

g2218.definition: [ζυγός] from the root of ζεύγνυμι (to join, especially by a "yoke"); a coupling, i.e. (figuratively) servitude (a law or obligation); also (literally) the beam of the balance (as connecting the scales)

g2219.definition: [ζύμη] probably from {{g2204}}; ferment (as if boiling up)

g2221.definition: [ζωγρέω] from the same as {{g2226}} and {{g64}}; to take alive (make a prisoner of war), i.e. (figuratively) to capture or ensnare

g2223.definition: [ζώνη] probably akin to the base of {{g2218}}; a belt; by implication, a pocket

g2224.definition: [ζώννυμι] from {{g2223}}; to bind about (especially with a belt)

g2225.definition: [ζωογονέω] from the same as {{g2226}} and a derivative of {{g1096}}; to engender alive, i.e. (by analogy) to rescue (passively, be saved) from death

g2226.definition: [ζῶον] neuter of a derivative of {{g2198}}; a live thing, i.e. an animal

g2227.definition: [ζωοποιέω] from the same as {{g2226}} and {{g4160}}; to (re-)vitalize (literally or figuratively)

g2228.definition: [ἤ] a primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than Often used in connection with other particles. Compare especially {{g2235}}, {{g2260}}, {{g2273}}.

g2229.definition: [ἦ] an adverb of confirmation; perhaps intensive of {{g2228}}; used only (in the New Testament) before {{g3303}}; assuredly

g2231.definition: [ἡγεμονία] from {{g2232}}; government, i.e. (in time) official term

g2232.definition: [ἡγεμών] from {{g2233}}; a leader, i.e. chief person (or figuratively, place) of a province

g2233.definition: [ἡγέομαι] middle voice of a (presumed) strengthened form of {{g71}}; to lead, i.e. command (with official authority); figuratively, to deem, i.e. consider

g2234.definition: [ἡδέως] adverb from a derivative of the base of {{g2237}}; sweetly, i.e. (figuratively) with pleasure

g2235.definition: [ἤδη] apparently from {{g2228}} (or possibly {{g2229}}) and {{g1211}}; even now

g2236.definition: [ἥδιστα] neuter plural of the superlative of the same as {{g2234}}; with great pleasure

g2237.definition: [ἡδονή] from ἁνδάνω (to please); sensual delight; by implication, desire

g2238.definition: [ἡδύοσμον] neuter of the compound of the same as {{g2234}} and {{g3744}}; a sweet-scented plant, i.e. mint

g2239.definition: [ἦθος] a strengthened form of {{g1485}}; usage, i.e. (plural) moral habits

g2240.definition: [ἥκω] a primary verb; to arrive, i.e. be present (literally or figuratively)

g2241.definition: [ἠλί] of Hebrew origin ({{h410}} with pronominal suffix); my God

g2242.definition: [Ἡλί] of Hebrew origin ({{h5941}}); Heli (i.e. Eli), an Israelite

g2243.definition: [Ἡλίας] of Hebrew origin ({{h452}}); Helias (i.e. Elijah), an Israelite

g2244.definition: [ἡλικία] from the same as {{g2245}}; maturity (in years or size)

g2245.definition: [ἡλίκος] from ἧλιξ (a comrade, i.e. one of the same age); as big as, i.e. (interjectively) how much

g2246.definition: [ἥλιος] from ἕλη (a ray; perhaps akin to the alternate of {{g138}}); the sun; by implication, light

g2247.definition: [ἧλος] of uncertain affinity; a stud, i.e. spike

g2249.definition: [ἡμεῖς] nominative plural of {{g1473}}; we (only used when emphatic)

g2250.definition: [ἡμέρα] feminine (with {{g5610}} implied) of a derivative of ἧμαι (to sit; akin to the base of {{g1476}}) meaning tame, i.e. gentle; day, i.e. (literally) the time space between dawn and dark, or the whole 24 hours (but several days were usually reckoned by the Jews as inclusive of the parts of both extremes); figuratively, a period (always defined more or less clearly by the context)

g2252.definition: [ἤμην] a prolonged form of {{g2258}}; I was (Sometimes unexpressed).

g2253.definition: [ἡμιθανής] from a presumed compound of the base of {{g2255}} and {{g2348}}; half dead, i.e. entirely exhausted

g2254.definition: [ἡμῖν] dative case plural of {{g1473}}; to (or for, with, by) us

g2255.definition: [ἥμισυ] neuter of a derivative from an inseparable prefix akin to {{g260}} (through the idea of partition involved in connection) and meaning semi-; (as noun) half

g2256.definition: [ἡμιώριον] from the base of {{g2255}} and {{g5610}}; a half-hour

g2257.definition: [ἡμῶν] genitive case plural of {{g1473}}; of (or from) us

g2258.definition: [ἦν] imperfect of {{g1510}}; I (thou, etc.) was (wast or were)

g2259.definition: [ἡνίκα] of uncertain affinity; at which time

g2260.definition: [ἤπερ] from {{g2228}} and {{g4007}}; than at all (or than perhaps, than indeed)

g2261.definition: [ἤπιος] probably from {{g2031}}; properly, affable, i.e. mild or kind

g2262.definition: [Ἤρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h6147}}); Er, an Israelite

g2263.definition: [ἤρεμος] perhaps by transposition from {{g2048}} (through the idea of stillness); tranquil

g2264.definition: [Ἡρώδης] compound of ἥρως (a "hero") and {{g1491}}; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings

g2265.definition: [Ἡρωδιανοί] plural of a derivative of {{g2264}}; Herodians, i.e. partisans of Herod

g2266.definition: [Ἡρωδιάς] from {{g2264}}; Herodias, a woman of the Heodian family

g2268.definition: [Ἡσαΐας] of Hebrew origin ({{h3470}}); Hesaias (i.e. Jeshajah), an Israelite

g2269.definition: [Ἠσαῦ] of Hebrew origin ({{h6215}}); Esau, an Edomite

g2270.definition: [ἡσυχάζω] from the same as {{g2272}}; to keep still (intransitively), i.e. refrain from labor, meddlesomeness or speech

g2271.definition: [ἡσυχία] feminine of {{g2272}}; (as noun) stillness, i.e. desistance from bustle or language

g2272.definition: [ἡσύχιος] a prolonged form of a compound probably of a derivative of the base of {{g1476}} and perhaps {{g2192}}; properly, keeping one's seat (sedentary), i.e. (by implication) still (undisturbed, undisturbing)

g2274.definition: [ἡττάω] from the same as {{g2276}}; to make worse, i.e. vanquish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to rate lower

g2275.definition: [ἥττημα] from {{g2274}}; a deterioration, i.e. (objectively) failure or (subjectively) loss

g2276.definition: [ἥττον] neuter of comparative of ἧκα (slightly) used for that of {{g2556}}; worse (as noun); by implication, less (as adverb)

g2277.definition: [ἤτω] third person singular imperative of {{g1510}}; let him (or it) be

g2278.definition: [ἠχέω] from {{g2279}}; to make a loud noise, i.e. reverberate

g2279.definition: [ἦχος] of uncertain affinity; a loud or confused noise ("echo"), i.e. roar; figuratively, a rumor

g2280.definition: [Θαδδαῖος] of uncertain origin; Thaddæus, one of the Apostles

g2281.definition: [θάλασσα] probably prolonged from {{g251}}; the sea (genitive case or specially)

g2282.definition: [θάλπω] probably akin to θάλλω (to warm); to brood, i.e. (figuratively) to foster

g2283.definition: [Θάμαρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h8559}}); Thamar (i.e. Tamar), an Israelitess

g2284.definition: [θαμβέω] from {{g2285}}; to stupefy (with surprise), i.e. astound

g2285.definition: [θάμβος] akin to an obsolete τάφω (to dumbfound); stupefaction (by surprise), i.e. astonishment

g2287.definition: [θανατήφορος] from (the feminine form of) {{g2288}} and {{g5342}}; death-bearing, i.e. fatal

g2288.definition: [θάνατος] from {{g2348}}; (properly, an adjective used as a noun) death (literally or figuratively)

g2290.definition: [θάπτω] a primary verb; to celebrate funeral rites, i.e. inter

g2291.definition: [Θάρα] of Hebrew origin ({{h8646}}); Thara (i.e. Terach), the father of Abraham

g2292.definition: [θαῤῥέω] another form for {{g2293}}; to exercise courage Compare {{g5111}}.

g2295.definition: [θαῦμα] apparently from a form of {{g2300}}; wonder (properly concrete; but by implication, abstract)

g2296.definition: [θαυμάζω] from {{g2295}}; to wonder; by implication, to admire

g2297.definition: [θαυμάσιος] from {{g2295}}; wondrous, i.e. (neuter as noun) a miracle

g2298.definition: [θαυμαστός] from {{g2296}}; wondered at, i.e. (by implication) wonderful

g2300.definition: [θεάομαι] a prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. (by implication) perceive (literally or figuratively); by extension to visit Compare {{g3700}}.
